text: Four ships of the French Navy have been named in honour of Armand-Jean du Plessis, Cardinal Richelieu, considered to be one of the founders of the French Navy. == Ships == * (1873), a central battery ironclad.Roche, vol.2, p.423In French Navy parlance, an "armoured frigate" ("frégate cuirassée"). * (1915), an auxiliary patrol boat. * (1939), a fast battleship. * was originally to have been named Richelieu.Roche, vol.2, p.128 * French aircraft carrier PA2 (now cancelled) would potentially have been named Richelieu. ==Notes and references== === Notes === ===References=== === Bibliography === * Category:French Navy ship names
title: French ship Richelieu
